Compute Log-Likelihoods for All Grid Values of PSD (Predictive Standard Deviation)

Source: R/01_likelihood.R
compute_L_gaussian_helper_seq.Rd

Computes the log-likelihood for a single dataset across all values of psd_iwp specified in the grid. This function iteratively calls compute_L_gaussian_helper for each grid value.

compute_L_gaussian_helper_seq(
  data_i,
  Si,
  Omegai,
  grid,
  num_basis = 30,
  betaprec = 1e-06,
  order = 2,
  pred_step = 1
)

Arguments

data_i

A single dataset extracted from the data_list component of fash_set_data. Must be a list containing y, x, and offset.

Si

A numeric vector representing the standard errors for the dataset.

Omegai

A numeric precision matrix for the dataset.

grid

A numeric vector representing the grid of PSD (Predictive Standard Deviation) values.

num_basis

An integer specifying the number of O-Spline basis functions.

betaprec

A numeric value representing the precision of the fixed effects coefficients.

order

An integer specifying the order of the Integrated Wiener Process (IWP) prior.

pred_step

A numeric value specifying the prediction step size.

Value

A numeric vector of log-likelihood values, one for each grid value.

Examples

# Example usage
set.seed(1)
Y <- matrix(rnorm(20), nrow = 4, ncol = 5)
smooth_var <- matrix(runif(20), nrow = 4, ncol = 5)
offset <- 1
S <- c(0.5, 0.8, 1.2, 1.0, 0.9)
Omega <- diag(5)
data <- fash_set_data(Y, smooth_var, offset, S, Omega)
grid <- seq(0.1, 2, length.out = 10)
likelihoods <- compute_L_gaussian_helper_seq(
  data$data_list[[1]], Si = S[[1]], Omegai = Omega, grid = grid
)
#> Error in compute_L_gaussian_helper_seq(data$data_list[[1]], Si = S[[1]],     Omegai = Omega, grid = grid): could not find function "compute_L_gaussian_helper_seq"
